remarks: If a topology is connected, its underlying set can't be partitioned into two nonempty non-overlapping open sets.  (Contributed by FL, 16-Nov-2008.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 10-Mar-2015.)
statement:
iscon.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
conclo.1 $e |- ( ph -> J e. Con ) $.
conclo.2 $e |- ( ph -> A e. J ) $.
conclo.3 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= (/) ) $.
conndisj.4 $e |- ( ph -> B e. J ) $.
conndisj.5 $e |- ( ph -> B =/= (/) ) $.
conndisj.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( A i^i B ) = (/) ) $.
conndisj $p |- ( ph -> ( A u. B ) =/= X ) $.
